intro: Acronema sichuanense, commonly known as the Sichuan acronema, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions.
